node.title: [Porousflow] PorousFlowSink is independent to time for some reason
node.bodyText:
Hi guys,
so my PorousFlowSink is independent to time for some reason
[rainfall_recharge]
   type = PorousFlowSink
    boundary = 'left'
    variable = porepressure
    flux_function = -1
     save_in = fluxes_out
[]

I check the total flux via NodalSum
  [left_flux]
    type = NodalSum
    boundary = 'left'
    variable = fluxes_out
    execute_on = 'timestep_end'
  []

here are my [Executioner] and [PorousFlowUnsaturated] blocks:
[PorousFlowUnsaturated]
porepressure = porepressure
coupling_type = Hydro
gravity = '0 0 -9.81'
fp = the_simple_fluid
time_unit = years
add_darcy_aux = false
[]

[Executioner]
type = Transient
start_time = 0
dt = 0.001
end_time = 0.01
solve_type = NEWTON
petsc_options = '-snes_converged_reason'
petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
petsc_options_value = 'hypre    boomeramg'
nl_rel_tol = 1e-3
nl_abs_tol = 8e0
l_tol = 1e-5
l_max_its = 150
nl_max_its = 50
line_search = none
automatic_scaling = true
[]

the surface area of the 'left' boundary is 350 m2
from the document flux_function of the PorousFlowSink is in kg.m-2.s-1
As can be seen above, my time unit is 'year' and dt is 0.001
HOWEVER, the Nodalsum still gives me 350 kg which is the case for time unit = sec and dt = 1
and doesn't matter what the dt is, it still gives me the same value
Postprocessor Values:
+----------------+----------------+
| time           | left_flux      |
+----------------+----------------+
|   0.000000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |
|   1.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   2.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   3.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   4.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   5.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   6.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   7.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   8.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   9.000000e-03 |  -3.500000e+02 |
|   1.000000e-02 |  -3.500000e+02 |
+----------------+----------------+
Not sure if I've missed anything, if you have an idea please let me know.
Thank you!
Traiwit

The same thing also happens when I checked with
/modules/porous_flow/examples/groundwater/ex02_steady_state.i
Not sure if NodalSum does not read the flux properly or if something is wrong with the BC

Hi @Traiwit ,
Have a look at https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/boundaries.html .   You'll see the NodalSum is measured in kg/s.   In your case, it will be kg/year - see the "Alternative time units" section of https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/PorousFlowSingleComponentFluid.html , viz "fluid sources must be measured in kg/m3/time" (and areal sources in kg/m2/time , but i didn't write that in the doco, ooops).

Noted, thanks @WilkAndy
I thought NodalSum would sum to mass (or volume) that passes thru the boundary at a particular time.
just wondering is there any object that can do that kinda thing?
Not that i know of, @Traiwit .   I usually use a Postprocessor to capture "dt", and then a ParsedAux to multiply by it in order to get the mass flowing through the boundary for a particular time step

node.title: The distribution within an element for a 1 D transport problem
node.bodyText:
I am trying to solve for a 1 D transport problem. I got the result and found that there was a distribution inside a single element. I am a little confused about that.
The problem definition was like this: A species transported from the left to right. It was driven by the velocity. I had a left and right boundary condition given the amount of the species and would like to know the amount distribution along the domain. The geometry was 5 cm with 10 elements.
I could compile my application and get the result. The question was, there was a distribution inside a single element. But I thought it should be a unifrom distribution inside a single element and the changes should only located between elements since each element should be regared as a "unit" one.
I am trying to find out a explanation on this. MOOSE is computing the kernel at quadrature points. But I think this is not going to cause any difference inside the element.
Any help are appreciated.
Yang

Hello
What kind of variables are you using?
The default variable type is 1st order lagrange, which is linear across each element
Guillaume

I didn't specify the variable type. When I defined the variable, I just gave the name.
So my variable is 1st order lagrange, right? Does this mean the shape functions are first order?
Beside, how the result for one single element was comupted? Is there any functions or kernels that I can use to compute the relationship between the species ammout with the x axis?

yes then it is the default, and the shape functions are first order.
The solution is defined continuously over the domain. If you want the average over a single element you ll have to project it to a CONSTANT MONOMIAL using a SelfAux

OK. Thank you very much for your help.
Besides, is there any syntax specified the number of quadrature points? What is the relationship between the qp point result and the result for one element?

There is the quadrature block under the executioner.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/actions/SetupQuadratureAction.html
The qp value can be computed from the nodal values and vice-versa. We output and store nodal values, computations like the residuals use the qp values
Then what is the relationship between nodal and element? For a 1 D problem, if I had 10 elements, does it mean I had 11 nodes? If qp can be computed by nodal values, then there would be 11 qp values?
10 elements -> 11 nodes but for the Qps it will depend on the quadrature order

I see. So the Qp only relevant to the quadrature order, right? I mean, if I defined the order of my variable, then the qps for each element will be decided. Is it correct? Or is there another function to specify the qp.

no the variable order and the quadrature order are different.
the quadrature may be changed in Executioner/quadrature.
It is also adjusted by default to be able to integrate the variable family types used

Usually we don't need to define the qp right? Or it is defined by the variable family? Are they relevant to the geometry/mesh ?
Sorry I am kind of confused about this part. Especially when I got a result plot in peacock with colorbar. I am curious on how these values are computed.

The Qps, and their weight, are defined by the quadrature.
What you are seeing in paraview are the nodal value, and paraview knows to draw them continuously for point data

node.title: Compilation with libtorch
node.bodyText:
I would like to use libtorch capabilities within MOOSE.
I am using linux machine and followed the installation instructions for HPC:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/hpc_install_moose.html
Then I installed libtorch:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/install_libtorch.html
I am able to execute tests:
./run_tests -j 8 --re libtorch_nn
However, when I create a custom app and enable in the Makefile the Stochastic Tools module:
STOCHASTIC_TOOLS := yes
it kind of does not see the module and as a result, stochastic tools do not work.
SO in general the problem is that the custom app does not see individal modules, while
ALL_MODULES := yes
works. How to fix this?
@grmnptr
Could you write here down step by step what you are doing? I mean during the installation of the custom app.

sorry, the problem was is that I did not understand the meaning of:
ifeq ($(ENABLE_LIBTORCH),true)
app_non_unity_dirs = %src/surrogates
endif

node.title: Change mesh from one simulation to another
node.bodyText:
Hi everybody!
I need to simulate a Zry cladding oxide spallation, making the oxide grow before spalling. So, I planned to first do the oxide growth on a whole block until the desired thickness and then, make a second simulation where I would remove part of this block (this would be the spalled part), but I wanted to use some data from the first simulation, as the temperature profile, by setting the "restar_file_base" on [Problem] block, however, I receive an error doing this, I must use the same mesh for both.
So, is there a way that I can make modifications in the mesh on the second simulation and use the data from the first one?

Hello
You ll want to use the SolutionUserObject to do that.
Alternatively you can load the other mesh in a MultiApp and transfer information from there
Guillaume

I was able to load the variable values and use as IC for the second simulation, however I could not retrieve the oxide thickness, because it is set as AuxVariable, and I cannot set IC for AuxVariable.
use an auxkernel executed on INITIAL for an IC of an AuxVariable

node.title: Implementing user-defined Permeability Material in PorousFlow
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I’m following the layout of Kozeny-Carman permeability material in PorousFlow to develop my own permeability material. I’m kinda stuck on how the Jacobian/derivative of the K-C material was derived w.r.t to the Variables (i.e., _dpermeability_qp_dvar[_qp][v]). Can someone pls walk me through it? Btw, is there a way to add these derivatives automatically or you need to manually compute and implement these derivatives? My permeability model is not dependent on the porosity, but on the strain as follows:
k=k_m*I + b/a [(b^2/12 - k_m)] (I-M), where b=b_0 + /Deltab and /Deltab=a 〈/epsilon_n -/epsilon_0〉.
I already derived the derivative of k with respect to the strain (/epsilon) but I’m not sure if I need to compute and implement the derivative of k with respect to porosity. Thanks.

Hi, @cpgr and @WilkAndy
I’m trying to implement the permeability model described on page 6 of Zill et al. (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijrmms.2021.104879). I’m following the layout of PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman. Is this the right approach to implement a user-defined permeability in PorousFlow? or do I have to follow the layout of PorousFlowPorosityLinear since my permeability does not depend on porosity? I got stuck with computing the derivatives while following PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman. If I have to go with the PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman, do I need to find the derivative wrt porosity or the strain? Thanks.

If permeability doesn't depend on porosity, then the simpler option of following PorousFlowPorosityLinear should be ok (ie you get the strain and it's derivatives as material properties, and use them when calculating your permeability.
PorousFlow isn't set up to make full use of AD yet, so this would need to be by hand.

Thanks, @cpgr.
Just a couple of questions: What material provides the derivatives of the porosity (i.e.,_dporosity_qp_dvar and _dporosity_qp_dgradvar ) on lines 66 and 67 of PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman? I’m guessing that I can use the following derivatives for the strain in my implementation: _dvol_strain_qp_dvar and _dvol_strain_qp_dgradvar. Correct?
Why were _dpermeability_qp_dvar[_qp][v] and _dpermeability_qp_dgradvar[_qp][i][v] calculated on lines 100 and 106 in the PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman permeability model? I’m trying to implement _dpermeability_qp_dgradvar[_qp][i][v] in my own model, but I can’t find _dvol_strain_qp_dgradvar in any of the source or header files in PorousFlow. How do I obtain _dvol_strain_qp_dgradvar? Thanks.

Thanks, @WilkAndy
From your feedback, I don’t need the derivatives after all. I’m going to go ahead and implement the permeability following PorousFlowPermeabilityKozenyCarman w/o them. Please, keep this ticket open for now, as I need to sit down on your feedback to grasp it fully. I’m going to be chipping in some questions from time to time. Thanks a lot guys @WilkAndy @cpgr !

node.title: Using source files in tests directory of modules
node.bodyText:
I am working on some module and framework development, and I would like to put the source files in the tests directory rather than the main framework as they are specialized rather than general. In particular, I'm in the Tensor Mechanics Module.
I have registered the files in TensorMechanicsTestApp like the other files in there. However, when I use either the moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/tensor_mechanics-opt executable or the combined-opt executable, both times I get an error message from running input files:
*** ERROR ***
A 'MyTestObject' is not a registered object.
The same thing happens when I run the modules/tensor_mechanics/test/tests/domain_integral_thermal/interaction_integral_2d_eig_grad.i input file:
*** ERROR ***
A 'FunctionIsotropicEigenstrain' is not a registered object.
The Makefile of those codes has the USE_TEST_LIBS     := yes flag. But is there something else I need in order to actually use those compiled objects? For the framework, I know that the moose_test-opt executable does contain the test objects.

You ll need to pass --allow-test-object on the command line
same in the tests configuration files iirc

actually no it s the other way, there is a flag to disallow them
--disallow-test-objects                           Don't register test objects and syntax

node.title: workflow for updating large_media
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
In a PR of mine, I've got some pics that need to be placed into large_media.  I've obviously mucked something up with git, as i get: "Failed to merge submodule large_media (not checked out)" from the CIVET precheck.   Can someone help please?
I looked at the related discussion, #18387 , but that doesn't seem relevant here.
Here's roughly what i did:
cd ~/projects/moose/large_media
git checkout master
git pull
cd ~/projects/moose
git submodule update large_media
cd ~/projects/moose/large_media/geochemistry
git add <my files>
git commit -m "geoechemistry pics added.  Refs #21592"
git push
cd ~/projects/moose
git add large_media
git commit -m "large media updated with biogeochemistry pics"
git push origin biogeochem_21559

Hello
What does git show say on this commit?
Guillaume

> git show

commit e1cade2cf70ca49d09ba6a529f2e63ae0d88c207 (HEAD -> biogeo_21559, origin/biogeo_21559)
Author: Andy Wilkins <andrew.wilkins@csiro.au>
Date:   Mon Aug 1 14:11:06 2022 +1000

    doc and tests and cpgr changes
    
    also: large_media updated with biogeochemistry pics
    
    Refs #21559

diff --git a/large_media b/large_media
index e1211aaf2d..50849f0697 160000
--- a/large_media
+++ b/large_media
@@ -1 +1 @@
-Subproject commit e1211aaf2dec766e9a8e2da1631ee2f36ec7c5de
+Subproject commit 50849f069720666d8979e0083bd19dea5dc69e11
...

Please could you help, @GiudGiud .   I just removed the "git add large_media" from my PR ( #21592 ) and now the precheck of CIVET passes.  However, CIVET is pulling the wrong commit of large_media:
BUILD_ROOT/moose/: git submodule update --init --checkout --reference /data/gitrefs/github.com/idaholab/large_media large_media
Submodule 'large_media' (https://github.com/idaholab/large_media) registered for path 'large_media'
Cloning into '/data/civet3/build/moose/large_media'...
Submodule path 'large_media': checked out '88bc8647f9f9954554485d010d7a6311e20fca71'

it should be checking out 50849f069720666d8979e0083bd19dea5dc69e11 , which is the latest commit to large_media that includes my additions.  This means that my PR will probably eventually fail because the documentation website will not build correctly.

ok I just tried the same thing you did.
If that doesnt work, I d rebase your PR on current moose/devel.

I believe that your PR with the updated large_media submodule failed in the same way as mine did (above)   Are you sure that it isn't something to do with
git submodule update --init --checkout --reference /data/gitrefs/github.com/idaholab/large_media large_media

somehow not getting my latest commit into large_media ?

@GiudGiud , i believe your attempt above failed.  So, i have now done the following, after all my MOOSE commits
git fetch upstream
git rebase upstream/next
git add large_media
git commit -m "Andy performed git add large_media after rebasing from upstream/next"
git push -f origin biogeo_21559

yeah that was the thing to do
the line that mattered and that I missed
CONFLICT (submodule): Merge conflict in large_media
it could not merge your PR into devel because of the difference in submodules
Thank you @GiudGiud .   It has passed the precheck.  I will close this discussion if it passes all tests.
btw you should rebase off of devel not next. You wont get coverage diffs off of next

The PR now passes.  In conclusion:

the workflow presented in my initial question was almost correct
At some stage, for example before the git add large_media, i should have git fetch upstream ; git rebase upstream/next
Thanks for working with me on this, @GiudGiud

node.title: restart with distributed mesh?
node.bodyText:
I run rather large simulations and I need to do an initial run in which the system equilibrates. After that, I need to read in the equilibrated solution to seed a new calculation that has added driving forces. I know how to do this using replicated meshes. However, I need to use distributed (parallel) meshes in order to avoid running out of memory. The descriptions of restart (Variable Initialization or using SolutionUserObject) indicate that these methods only work for replicated meshes. Is this still true or is there a capability do do these restarts with distributed mesh?
Thanks.

For distributed meshes you should look at checkpoint restart.
I dont know about solutionUO. @friedmud or @permcody ?
Hi Guillaume. Yes, I routinely use checkpoint but my understanding is that with checkpointing you are limited to using the exact same variables as in the prior runs. Is that not the case?

It is the case.
@friedmud is working on a more flexible checkpoint
OK - thanks!

node.title: How to setup boundary conditions for a loop
node.bodyText:
I want to simulate the fluid dynamic for a loop but I am a little confused on the definition on the boundary conditions. I know for a tube problem, we always have a left side and right side boundary conditions. But what if it is for a loop problem? Is there any reference to start with?
Many thanks for any help.

Hello
for a loop, in multidimensional problems you ll have boundary conditions for the walls of the loop.
But there won’t be any inlet or outlet boundary conditions.
Are you planning to use Navier Stokes for multiD flow or the thermal hydraulics module for 1D flow? We should be able to point you to some examples
Guillaume

Hi,
I am not using specified module to solve the problem. I want to solve a simplified transport equation for a 1D tube. So I assembled some kernels together. Now I want to move to a loop problem but now I am a litte confused on how to setup the boundary condition?

So if you're doing a 1D loop, then I reckon you dont need a boundary condition since there's no boundaries.
You may need a constraint on pressure if you are doing incompressible flow though. You can either pin the value at a point or pin the average of the pressure over the domain.
That makes sense. Thank you so much.

node.title: Error starting Peacock
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I have recently installed MOOSE on Ubuntu but I am unable to start up Peacock. I am getting this error message ->
Error starting peacock: Could not import vtk
You need to use the miniconda module. Run:
module load miniconda
I had already installed miniconda for the installation of MOOSE and I have also installed the additional libraries/packages from the manual_miniconda section in installation. But I am still getting this error. I am assuming I have missed something? The MOOSE installation passed or skipped with no fails so I thought this would be okay.
Any help would be great!
Thanks in advance.

Hello
mamba install vtk should be all you need to do to fix this
Guillaume

Actually there is a new package available that installs everything necessary to launch Peacock. The only caveat, is that you must install this package into a new environment, and remember to activate this environment whenever you want to use Peacock:
mamba activate base     # get back to the default environment
mamba create -n peacock moose-peacock
mamba activate peacock
<run peacock>
You can run any number of different environments, so long as you run then in different terminal windows.
While currently installing moose-peacock into your running moose environment (the environment that you created during the 'Getting Started' steps: mamba create -n moose moose-libmesh moose-tools) might work now. It will not work in the future. So save yourself the headache, and separate these environments now.

I would do mamba install moose-libmesh moose-tools moose-peacock since I would want to run the moose apps from peacock?
Either way, this is great, will simplify installing peacock for sure!

You can run Peacock in a different environment than what was used to build moose-based applications.
The reason we want to instruct users to separate environments running moose-libmesh and moose-peacock now, is because the two environments will eventually differ to the point where mamba install moose-libmesh moose-peacock will cause conflicts.
The reason: PyQT is not being built using every compiler being made available on conda-forge. At some point, when we move to Clang 13, PyQt may not. And thus; an impossible solve situation during an install. Best to teach folks now, to keep these separate.

Hello, i used the ' mamba create -n  peacock python=3.10' command to create a separate environment for 'peacock'  on CentOS 7, but then my screen showed "nothing provides requested moose -peacock" when i  typed the 'mamba install moose-peacock' into the terminal. I wanna know how to install peacock on a separate environment created by mamba.
Thank you for your replying!
Best Regards
